}} 'Î²-Carotene' is a strongly-coloured red-orange pigment abundant in plants and
fruits. It is an organic compound and chemically is classified as a hydrocarbon
and specifically as a terpenoid (isoprenoid), reflecting its derivation from
isoprene units. Î²-Carotene is biosynthesized from geranylgeranyl
pyrophosphate. It is a member of the carotenes, which are
tetraterpenes, synthesized biochemically from eight isoprene units and thus
having 40 carbons. Among this general class of carotenes, Î²-carotene is
distinguished by having beta-rings at both ends of the molecule. Absorption of
Î²-carotene is enhanced if eaten with fats, as carotenes are fat soluble.

Carotene is the substance in carrots that colours them orange and is the most
common form of carotene in plants. When used as a food colouring, it has the E
number E160a. p119 The structure
was deduced by Karrer et al. in 1930. {{cite journal
| title = Pflanzenfarbstoffe XXV. Ãber die Konstitution des Lycopins und
| Carotins author = P. Karrer, A. Helfenstein, H. Wehrli, A. Wettstein journal =
| Helvetica Chimica Acta volume = 13 issue = 5 pages = 1084â1099 year = 1930 url
| = doi = 10.1002/hlca.19300130532 }} In nature, Î²-carotene is a precursor
| (inactive form) to vitamin A via the action of beta-carotene 15,15'-
| monooxygenase. {{cite journal title = Vitamin A in Kirk-Othmer
| Encyclopedia of Chemical Technology author = Susan D. Van Arnum publisher =
| John Wiley location = New York issue = 45 pages =99â107 year = 1998 url = doi
| = 10.1002/0471238961.2209200101181421.a01 chapter = Vitamin A isbn = 0-471-23896-
| 1}} Isolation of Î²-carotene from fruits abundant in carotenoids is
| commonly done using column chromatography. The separation of Î²-carotene from
| the mixture of other carotenoids is based on the polarity of a compound. Î²-
| Carotene is a non-polar compound, so it is separated with a non-polar solvent
| such as hexane. {{cite journal doi = 10.1021/jf980405r title = Carotenoids
| from Guava (Psidium guajava L.): Isolation and Structure Elucidation author =
| Mercadante, A.Z., Steck, A., Pfander, H. journal = J. Agric. Food Chem. volume
| = 47 issue = 1| pages = 145â151 year = 1999 pmid = 10563863}} Being
| highly conjugated, it is deeply coloured, and as a hydrocarbon lacking
| functional groups, it is very lipophilic.
